intro: Philenoptera wankieensis, commonly known as the Wankie milkweed, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, attracting various pollinators. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds.
